main_definition: Affordable in price or easily obtained; sometimes with a negative connotation of low quality.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not expensive, offering good value for the money spent.
meanings_and_examples.example: The store was selling cheap jackets at affordable prices.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Low quality or of inferior workmanship; not worth much in terms of value or durability.
meanings_and_examples.example: She regretted buying a cheap pair of shoes that fell apart after a few uses.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Easy to obtain, often with little effort required.
meanings_and_examples.example: He found cheap ways to travel around the city by using public transportation and biking.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Not sincere or lacking in warmth; frugal or stingy in interpersonal relationships.
meanings_and_examples.example: She was accused of being cheap because she rarely showed physical affection towards her friends.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having little monetary expense, especially when it comes to purchasing items.
meanings_and_examples.example: They live a cheap lifestyle by cooking at home and avoiding eating out frequently.
